snippet: A cultural and political shift in Germany exemplifies a rebirth of the Prussian values of thrift, independence and incorruptibility that Angela Merkel hopes to export.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Jacob Heilbrunn, senior editor at The National Interest, argues that Germany's celebration of the 300th anniversary of Frederick the Great, regarded by some as a worrisome revival of German militarism, is nothing to worry about; contends that in truth, the celebration embodies Germany's cultural and political shift to the Prussian values of thrift, independence and incorruptibility.
lead_paragraph: A cultural and political shift in Germany exemplifies a rebirth of the Prussian values of thrift, independence and incorruptibility that Angela Merkel hopes to export.

headline.seo: Frederick the Great and the New Old Germany
